title: League not opening?
body:
It will open the launcher telling me the client has changed, so I press launch and all I get is an error that says

 "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\api-ms-win-crt-multibyte-I1-1-0.dll is either not designed to run on Windows or it contains an error. Try installing the program again using the original installation media or contact your system administrator or the software vendor for support."

I've already uninstalled and reinstalled it again, and been getting this error again. I already deleted lol_client and lol_launcher and that didn't work. I tried changing the compatibility to Windows 7 (Which I am currently running it on) and nothing has worked, I still get the error every time I try. Anyone have any solutions?

replies.body: Something might have gone wrong during the initial installation if you're seeing that type of error. Doing the usual reinstall might miss some of the files, so let's try using our [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool) and running it with the options **reinstall AND clean uninstall** turned on. Let me know if that's able to help a little better!
What do I do when it leaves a folder on my desktop?

That folder will just be some logs that it created that could tell us a little more about what your pc was doing. In this case, you'll need to make sure that you ran it with the two options reinstall AND clean uninstall turned on.
Still didn't work :/ Even after reinstall and clean uninstall on.

Hmmmm strange. Let's go ahead and get you a little more in-depth troubleshooting from our friendly neighbor hood tech team. Reach out to them in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), and keep that folder with logs on hand in case they ask for any of them!
